intro: Indigastrum niveum, commonly known as the snow bell vine, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Indigastrum niveum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
